text: Is there a way to throw an error without a long stacktrace? Just a way to debug by so that I can break things without having a long stack trace clutter my terminal?

text:
The first one still provides a stack trace. The latter will flag you, but they don't stop execution. I suggested abbreviating the traces by default just the other day: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/40138>

I understand why they were skeptical, though I think the benefits would be greater than the costs.
